meanings.definition: To march faster or farther than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: During the race, the cheetah outmarches all other animals with its incredible speed.
meanings.sent2: The marathon runner outmarches his competitors, reaching the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident that he could outmarch his speedy opponent.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of the bands, the drumline outmarches the other musicians with their synchronized movements.
meanings.sent5: The determined hiker outmarches the storm, reaching the safety of the cabin before the rain starts.

meanings.sent1: The disciplined army outmarches all others in precision and coordination.
meanings.sent2: The dance troupe outmarches their previous performance with flawless choreography.
meanings.sent3: The penguin outmarches the other birds in the parade, waddling with perfect rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The synchronized swimmers outmarch their competitors with graceful movements in the water.
meanings.sent5: The marching band outmarches expectations, delivering a stunning halftime show.
